p: Influenza virus Type A can be divided into two distinct groups on the basis of their ability to cause disease. Highly pathogenic avian influenza (HPAI) can cause up to 100Â % mortality in birds [ 1]. To date, all outbreaks of the highly pathogenic form have been caused by influenza A viruses of subtypes H5 and H7. We will mainly focus on Influenza virus Type A, the most virulent human pathogen and cause of all flu pandemics.
